revised_title: The Role of Leaves in Restoring Atmospheric Air and Carbon Dioxide Absorption
tldr: The author conducted experiments on plant leaves and found that they restore the surrounding air by absorbing carbonic acid and releasing oxygenous gas. This process is influenced by light and continues even in the dark. Carbonic acid is not released during the healthy condition of the leaf, and the first portions of carbonic acid gas are taken up more eagerly by plants than the remaining portions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
